newsitem.title: UK: IPE oil futures trade flat in dull, quiet day.
newsitem.headline: IPE oil futures trade flat in dull, quiet day.

text.p: IPE Brent crude futures traded flat on Friday, little moved by NYMEX's opening, brokers said.
July Brent, the new front month contract, was just a cent a barrel up at $19.50 a barrel by 1430 gmt, after trading in a narrow range. June gas oil was up $1 at $173 a tonne.
In New York June crude oil futures were down just one cent at $21.29 a barrel.
"Its deadly quiet down here, we were looking at gasoline to come off when the NYMEX opened, which it did a little and then retraced. There is nothing going on," said one IPE broker.
Volumes were low, with less than 5,000 July lots traded.
Brokers said the market appeared set to fritter away the rest of the day, with no major news to shake them.

The market failed to flinch earlier at news of a lower North Sea Forties crude lifting schedule for June, which came in at 17.3 million barrels, compared to 22.45 million in May. This was broadly in line with market expectations.
